etymologies: late Middle English; earliest use found in Medulla Grammatice. Partly from curd + -ed

definitions: Formed into curd, or into a curd-like mass; coagulated, congealed.
Having or producing curds. Frequently as the second element of parasynthetic compounds, as e.g. white-curded, soft-curded, hard-curded, fine-curded, etc.
